the
record
In its first 18 months, the National Project in
Agricultural Communications . . .
enrolled 700 professional agricultural communicators in
project activities.
met on campus with the staffs of 26 land-grant colleges.
participated in activities of 33 agricultural and educa¬
tional associations arid organizations.
planned, produced and sold 250,000 agricultural career
brochures.
produced and sold 20, rented 13 television training kits.
conducted 3 clinics on publication layout and design.
managed national communications conference attended
by administrator-editor team from 50 land-grant colleges.
co-sponsored writing short course attended by 88 econo¬
mists and editors from 11 land-grant colleges and
USDA.
obtained and analyzed needs of colleges and television
stations for agricultural TV film.
coordinated production of experimental soil survey
report.
prepared and distributed 10 issues of AGRICOM.
arranged for judging and evaluation of 262 entries in
national cooperative information service fair.
partially financed planning, program and evaluation of
1954 AAACE meeting.
financed, supplemental distribution 600 copies of each
issue of ACE to administrative people and outside
interests.
launched continuing evaluation program on college pub¬
lications, with 35 institutions participating in first round.
produced writing manual, 3 slide sets for training in
publication layout and editing.
partially financed and participated in work of 12 dif¬
ferent planning and advisory committees.
